question: Which state approved a Rs 4,000-crore project aimed at promoting climate-resilient agriculture?
explanation: The Maharashtra government has approved a Rs 4,000-crore project aimed at promoting climate-resilient agriculture. The project has been named as the Nanaji Deshmukh Krishi Sanjivani Yojana. It will be implemented in 5,142 villages across 15 districts. In the the total cost of the project is Rs 4,000 crore, 70 percent of which will be borne by the World Bank while the state will contribute 30 percent over six years.
